column4: hi, I have found the problem with the tomcat6 installation. The file /usr/share/tomcat6/bin/bootstrap.jar is not created by the package
actually, bootstrap.jar is never created whatsoever, and does not exist anywhere on the file system
line 97 of /etc/init.d/tomcat6 is "if [ ! -f "$CATALINA_HOME/bin/bootstrap.jar" ]; then" where $CATALINA refers to /usr/share/tomcat6 but the file does not exist. How can I create this file?
can someone help?
did you remove the 'tomcat' package?
it sounds like you removed, but didn't purge, tomcat6
removed, reinstalled, purged, cleaned.... installed again... several times
I don't know. Sounds like you need to learn how to use SVN ;)
very funny.... "Override and commit" is NOT suppose to revert!!!
SVN is horrible - you can only commit on the very head (SVN doesn't support non-linear history) so you need to merge before committing.
#subversion
the question was not about svn, it's about recovering the deleted files removed by eclipse
#eclipse
if I was on Windows, I would download undelete and restore the files. This has nothing to do with svn or eclipse, but Linux
oh, you want a file recovery program?
amonst other thing. I have downloaded foremost, but I doN,t know how to restore PHP files, is it the same as restoring txt files?
http://tldp.org/HOWTO/Ext2fs-Undeletion-4.html
http://www.xs4all.nl/~carlo17/howto/undelete_ext3.html
I'm on ext4
PHP files *are* text files
then I can just restore with foremost using txt as extension?
